channel.title: Iso game concept - constructive feed back please
channel.description:
I have been considering to create an iso java game perhaps multiplayer. Kind of like cokestudios/habbo but my own style. I was wondering if it would be reasonable to go with java.
I'm thinking about using mysql as account db, and text/file based storage for room details.
though I am argueing if graphics maybe an issue with java. I am planning on using jpg/png/gif for the graphics and wondering what my limits will be when it comes to trying to make the switch to 3d when I have enough knowledge of the 3D api and how opengl works. [b]but for the time being im wondering if this is possible[/b] (i am pretty sure it is but please correct me): user is standing at X,Y. Player clicks to X1,Y1. Calculate delta D (d = distance) replace sprite to an animating one and move the sprite to the new location once the new location is reached, replace back to the sprite thats standing still.
From what i think it would be something very simple and achievable without hesitation, but I want to know if its a terrible idea or even worth investing my time in.
I have a flash version of this written in AS2 and another version written in AS3. The server is still in java. But im wondering if the client too is worth writing in java.

item.dc:creator: @quest_rs quest rs
item.description:
@quest_rs wrote:

ownagesbot:

Why would you store room details as text if you had a perfectly good database setup that could handle the job for you?

it would give me some practice on some stuff that i’m doing for school. I went with sql db for accounts to play around with sql a bit as i have a seperate course on it, and textfile to play around with some stuff in programming such as writing classes to simulate arrays. The point of the game is to not be super “bad” looking such as spel’s sarcasm there… but its to experiment with some things.

@unhandled & lawl, thank you i will keep that in mind. I’ve written some 3d but its always been scratch and never a conversion from 2->3d…

@bank, its not a multi-platform deal here, its just a small testing situation. but thats I’ve made a note to myself about that. Not planning on using a lot of API except for where i cant avoid em.

@abraham, don’t even bother posting on this thread unless you have something to contribute besides your spamming rofl’s.

I think people are focusing too much on the game itself when I am trying to focus on the concept of the design and its possibility. I’m looking for more feedback such as the ones lawl and unhandled gave, and also perhaps questions such as ownagesbot.
